performances.description: This version is the standard.  All other versions are compared to this one.
I argue this chunk of music containing the MLB jam after Truckin' is some of the best music the Grateful Dead have ever played. Bar none
This version is so silky and smooth, you just want to float away...

performances.venue: Oklahoma City Fairgrounds Arena Oklahoma City, OK
performances.description: Brilliant, glowing-embers version of MLB, rising, phoenix-like, from the ashes of Dark Star. Beautiful slide work from Jer...face-meltingly beautiful!
Comes out so weet from a disassembled Playin'.  The Aud is better to listen to.
Killer 90's MLB!!!
Melodic and inventive, this one goes everywhere you can think of
I know its listed as Dark Star, but its a true MLBJ.  Great country twang to it.
Listed as a Dark Star, but the last 4 minutes of this are solidly similar to a Mind Left Body, kinda similar groove. You'll love this one!

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: Unique "slow" version that caps off a monster jam out of Truckin'. Must hear material.
If you don't know... now you know.
Beautiful
Last one ever.  Great out of Corrina.
There is something indescribably sweet and perfect about this version...sounds like it could have been recorded for an album. I just love it.
Truckin'>OtherOne>MLB>Stella Blue~41 minutes of pure bliss. A floaty, dark starry O1 falls to near chaos and MLB crawls from the ashes towards Stella
Vince's first
Sandwiched between a dreamy Dark Star.  Not the definitive version perhaps, but it belongs in the discussion.
Beautiful, mellow version. Garica's tone is especially sweet, with an almost country-ish flavor; sounds like he's using a bit of slide?
MLB jam is HEady
Starts not too long into one of my favorite Dark Stars!

performances.venue: Curtis Hixon Convention Hall Tampa, FL
performances.description: Short but sweet
Pre drums jam emerges from a real heady He's Gone melts into the drums heavenly
An MLB and Mojo jam hybrid. Already submitted as mojo by cgarces. Only 3 minutes, but worth the trip.
The transition between NFA and Stella is about a minute of MLB. Not the best, but a unique transition and tease for 1979.
Mind Left Body/Music Never Stopped jam from Blues for Allah sessions. Wicked cool.
Comin' out of space into a short but sweet That would be something in the middle of a fantastic late era playin' sandwich. Stunning!
Of all of the MLB jams in TMNS, I think this one is best.
First MLBJ in between a great Good Lovin'. Pig makes it even more epic rapping all over it.
Like all from 1974, very unique. Starts in a fast jam and slows the band down in a cool way
